intro: Canthium costatum, commonly known as the winged senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, winged seeds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, with pairs of leaflets and a unique, serrated appearance. Canthium costatum produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
